DOC.brief_summary: Study Hypothesis: Reduction in albuminuria has been shown to decrease progression of diabetic nephropathy. In diabetic nephropathy patients treated with maximal antihypertensive doses with dual RAAS blockade (total daily dose valsartan 320 mg and either enalapril 40 mg or benazepril 40 mg daily, or losartan 100mg), persistent albuminuria reflects further additional RAAS activation. Microvascular renal disease due to increased RAAS activation may be more effectively treated with triple blockade by the addition of a direct renin inhibitor (DRI) Aliskiren.
DOC.brief_title: Triple Blockade of the Renin Angiotensin Aldosterone System in Diabetic (Type 1&2) Proteinuric Patients
DOC.criteria: Macroalbuminuria > 300mg/g Microalbuminuria 30300mg/g Stable on max dose of an ACEI or ARB (Can also be titrated to max dosage of ACEI and ARB and stable on those doses for at least 2 weeks) Blood pressure <130/80 mm Hg at time of enrollment Diabetic either Type 1 or 2 GFR <60 m/min Potassium > 5mg/dl at time of enrollment Pregnant History of Angioedema ACEI cough Allergic to ARB, ACEI, DRI A1C > 9%
